Definition: The ability to connect to and extract data from multiple enterprise systems, applications, and external sources
Key Components: Enterprise System Connectors; API Integration Framework; Database Connectivity; File System Integration; Web Scraping & Crawling;  MCP Server Integration; Agentic Data Access; Universal AI Connectors
Technologies: Apache NiFi, AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory; Custom connectors and adapters; OAuth 2.0 authentication frameworks;  Model Context Protocol (MCP); Anthropic/OpenAI/Google MCP SDKs; Fivetran, Airbyte; dbt for transformation; Apache Airflow 2.x
Maturity - Basic: Manual file uploads, single source integration
Maturity - Intermediate: 5-10 automated source connectors, scheduled batch processing
Maturity - Advanced: 20+ source connectors, real-time integration, error handling
Maturity - Optimized: 50+ sources, MCP-based universal connectors, agentic data access, self-service integration
Success Metrics: Number of integrated data sources; Integration reliability (uptime %); Time to integrate new source (hours); Data ingestion throughput (GB/hour)

Definition: The capability to analyze and extract structured information from unstructured documents including text, tables, images, and complex layouts
Key Components: OCR (Optical Character Recognition); Table Extraction; Layout Analysis; Entity Extraction; Metadata Extraction;  Multi-modal LLM Processing; Agentic Document Understanding; Complex Layout Analysis
Technologies: AWS Textract, Azure Form Recognizer, Google Document AI; Apache Tika; spaCy, Stanford NER; Custom ML models;  Claude 3.5 Vision; GPT-4V; Gemini Pro Vision; Anthropic Document Understanding; LlamaParse; Unstructured.io
Maturity - Basic: Text extraction from common formats (PDF, DOCX)
Maturity - Intermediate: Table extraction, basic entity recognition, 85%+ accuracy
Maturity - Optimized: Multi-modal LLM processing, agentic document workflows, 99%+ accuracy, self-correcting extraction
Success Metrics: Extraction accuracy rate (%); Processing speed (documents/minute); Supported document formats (#); Error rate in table extraction (%)

Definition: The capability to enhance captured knowledge with additional contextual information, classifications, and semantic annotations
Key Components: Automatic Tagging; Sentiment Analysis; Topic Modeling; Language Detection; Quality Scoring; Temporal Analysis;  LLM-Powered Classification; Automated Knowledge Tagging; Semantic Metadata Generation
Technologies: NLP libraries (spaCy, NLTK, Hugging Face Transformers); Topic modeling (LDA, BERTopic); Sentiment analysis models; Custom classification models;  LLM-based enrichment (Claude, GPT-4); Structured extraction APIs; LangChain extraction chains
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-powered contextual enrichment, automated ontology alignment, real-time semantic tagging
Success Metrics: Tagging accuracy (%); Number of metadata fields enriched; Enrichment processing time (seconds/document); User acceptance rate of automatic tags (%)

Definition: The capability to capture and process knowledge as it is created or modified, enabling immediate availability for consumption
Key Components: Event Stream Processing; Change Data Capture (CDC); Message Queue Integration; Stream Processing; Incremental Updates;  Streaming Vector Updates; Real-time Knowledge Graph Sync; Event-Driven RAG
Technologies: Apache Kafka; Debezium for CDC; AWS Kinesis Data Streams; Apache Flink;  Confluent Cloud; Amazon MSK; Real-time vector indexing; Streaming embeddings pipelines
Maturity - Intermediate: Batch updates every hour, basic streaming
Maturity - Advanced: Real-time streaming for critical sources, <5 min latency
Maturity - Optimized: Sub-second vector indexing, event-driven RAG updates, autonomous data freshness, streaming GraphRAG
Success Metrics: End-to-end latency (seconds); Event throughput (events/second); Stream processing reliability (%); Number of real-time sources

Definition: Entity resolution, relationship extraction, and graph schema design. The ability to build and maintain enterprise knowledge graphs that represent entities, relationships, and attributes in a connected graph structure.
Key Components: Graph Schema Design; Entity Extraction; Relationship Extraction; Graph Population; Graph Evolution; Property Enrichment;  GraphRAG Integration; Vector-Graph Hybrid Queries; Multi-hop Reasoning
Technologies: Neo4j, Amazon Neptune, Azure Cosmos DB (Gremlin API); Graph query languages (Cypher, Gremlin, SPARQL); Entity linking frameworks; Graph ML libraries (NetworkX, PyG);  GraphRAG (Microsoft); Neo4j + Vector Search; FalkorDB; Knowledge Graph + RAG hybrid architectures
Maturity - Basic: Simple graph with 100-1K entities, manual construction
Maturity - Optimized: 1M+ entities, GraphRAG-enabled, vector+graph hybrid queries, autonomous graph evolution
Success Metrics: Number of entities in graph; Number of relationships; Graph completeness score (%); Query response time (ms)

Definition: Define and maintain domain ontologies (entities, relationships, hierarchies, constraints).
Key Components: Ontology Definition; Concept Hierarchies; Property Definitions; Ontology Alignment; Reasoning Rules; Version Control;  AI-Assisted Ontology Design; Automated Concept Extraction; Dynamic Ontology Evolution
Technologies: Protégé ontology editor; Apache Jena for RDF management; OWL API; SPARQL;  LLM-assisted ontology generation; TopBraid EDG; PoolParty Semantic Suite; Automated ontology alignment
Maturity - Intermediate: Multi-level taxonomy, basic ontology with 50-100 concepts
Maturity - Advanced: Formal ontology with 200+ concepts, reasoning capabilities
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-assisted ontology creation, automated reasoning, 1000+ concepts, continuous evolution
Success Metrics: Number of ontology concepts; Ontology coverage (% of domain); Reasoning performance (inferences/second); Alignment accuracy with industry standards (%)

Definition: Conceptual and logical models that bridge business language to physical data. The capability to identify when different references represent the same real-world entity and link them together, enabling unified views across data sources
Key Components: Entity Matching; Record Linkage; Disambiguation; Identity Management; Cross-Reference Mapping;  LLM Entity Resolution; Embedding-Based Deduplication; Semantic Layer Integration
Technologies: Dedupe, RecordLinkage Python libraries; Fuzzy matching algorithms (Levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler); ML-based entity resolution models; Master Data Management (MDM) tools;  LLM-based entity resolution; Embedding-based matching; Unified semantic layers (dbt Semantic Layer)
Maturity - Basic: Manual entity matching, exact matches only
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-powered resolution, real-time cross-source reconciliation, 98%+ accuracy, semantic layer integration
Success Metrics: Entity resolution accuracy (%); False positive rate (%); Processing time per entity (ms); Coverage across data sources (%)

Definition: The capability to identify, classify, and model relationships between entities, enabling graph traversal and multi-hop reasoning. Linkage between semantic concepts and physical assets (tables, features, embeddings).
Key Components: Relationship Type Definition; Relationship Extraction; Relationship Validation; Temporal Relationships; Weighted Relationships; Hierarchical Relationships;  LLM Relationship Extraction; GNN Link Prediction; Temporal Knowledge Graphs
Technologies: Relation extraction models (SpanBERT, T5); Graph neural networks for link prediction; Rule-based relationship identification; Dependency parsing;  LLM relationship extraction; Graph Neural Networks (GNNs); PyTorch Geometric; DGL
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-powered extraction, GNN inference, temporal relationships, 95%+ accuracy, automated graph construction
Success Metrics: Number of relationship types; Relationship extraction accuracy (%); Graph density (relationships per entity); Relationship coverage (% of possible connections)

Definition: Centralized repository of business terms, definitions, owners, and synonyms. Hierarchical classification schemes for products, content, and organizational concepts. Canonical business metric definitions with calculation logic and dimensions.
Key Components: Business Glossary;Taxonomy Design; Auto-Classification; Multi-Label Classification; Faceted Classification; Classification Validation; Taxonomy Evolution;  LLM-Powered Classification; Few-Shot Learning; Adaptive Taxonomy Management
Technologies: Text classification models (BERT, RoBERTa, XGBoost); Hierarchical classification algorithms; Active learning; Taxonomy management tools;  LLM classification (fine-tuned models); Embedding-based categorization; SetFit; Few-shot classification
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-powered dynamic classification, few-shot adaptation, 98%+ accuracy, self-evolving taxonomies
Success Metrics: Classification accuracy (%); Taxonomy depth (levels); Coverage (% of content classified); User satisfaction with classifications (%)

Definition: The capability to store, index, and retrieve high-dimensional vector embeddings for semantic similarity search
Key Components: Vector Indexing; Embedding Storage; Similarity Search; Index Optimization; Batch Processing; Hybrid Search;  Hybrid Search (Vector + BM25); GPU Acceleration; Metadata Filtering; Multi-tenancy
Technologies: Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant, Milvus; MongoDb, pgvector (PostgreSQL extension); Amazon OpenSearch with k-NN; FAISS;  Chroma; Deep Lake; pgvector 0.7+; Hybrid search (vector + keyword); GPU-accelerated indexing
Maturity - Optimized: Billion-scale vectors, hybrid search, sub-100ms latency, auto-scaling, multi-tenant isolation
Success Metrics: Number of vectors stored; Query latency (ms); Recall@K accuracy (%); Index update throughput (vectors/second)

Definition: The capability to store and query graph-structured knowledge with native support for relationship traversal and pattern matching
Key Components: Graph Schema Management; Graph Indexing; Multi-Hop Queries; Pattern Matching; Graph Algorithms; Transaction Management;  Integrated Vector Search; GraphRAG Query Patterns; Graph-Vector Co-location
Technologies: Neo4j (Cypher queries); Amazon Neptune (Gremlin/SPARQL); ArangoDB (multi-model); TigerGraph; Postgres;  Neo4j Vector Index; GraphRAG patterns; Memgraph; Graph + Vector co-location
Maturity - Optimized: Integrated vector+graph queries, GraphRAG-native, billion-node scale, real-time sync
Success Metrics: Graph size (nodes + relationships); Query response time (ms); Graph algorithm performance; Data consistency score (%)

Definition: The capability to generate, version, and manage vector embeddings from text, images, and other content types
Key Components: Embedding Models; Batch Embedding; Incremental Updates; Multi-Modal Embeddings; Embedding Quality; Model Versioning;  Dimension-Adaptive Embeddings; Multi-modal Embeddings; Embedding Versioning; Late Interaction Models
Technologies: OpenAI Embeddings API (text-embedding-ada-002); Sentence Transformers (SBERT); MongoDb; Cohere Embed models; Custom fine-tuned models; AWS Bedrock Embeddings;  OpenAI text-embedding-3-large; Voyage AI; Nomic Embed; Cohere Embed v3; Matryoshka embeddings
Maturity - Basic: Single embedding model, batch processing only
Maturity - Optimized: Domain-specific fine-tuned embeddings, dimension-adaptive (Matryoshka), automated quality monitoring
Success Metrics: Embedding generation throughput (embeddings/second); Embedding quality score (retrieval accuracy); Model inference latency (ms); Storage efficiency (compression ratio)

Definition: The capability to intelligently combine multiple storage technologies (vector, graph, document, relational) for optimal performance and functionality
Key Components: Storage Orchestration; Cross-Store Queries; Data Synchronization; Query Optimization; Unified Access Layer; Cost Optimization;  Vector-Graph Unified Storage; Semantic Caching; Knowledge Lake Architecture
Technologies: Polyglot persistence patterns; GraphQL for unified queries; Change Data Capture; Apache Iceberg;  Unified vector-graph stores; LakeFS for versioning; Delta Lake 3.0; Apache Iceberg 1.4
Maturity - Advanced: 3+ storage types, automated routing, cross-store queries
Maturity - Optimized: Unified vector-graph-document storage, semantic caching, automated tiering, knowledge lake patterns
Success Metrics: Query routing accuracy (%); Cross-store query performance; Storage cost efficiency ($/GB); Data consistency across stores (%)

Definition: The capability to track changes to knowledge over time, maintaining historical versions and enabling rollback
Key Components: Version Tracking; Diff Generation; Rollback Capability; Audit Trail; Branching; Merge Strategies;  Embedding Version Control; Knowledge Lineage; Reproducible RAG Pipelines
Technologies: Git-like versioning systems; Temporal database features; Event sourcing patterns; Delta Lake;  LakeFS; Pachyderm; MLflow Model Registry; DVC for embeddings; Weights & Biases
Maturity - Advanced: Automated versioning, diff views, branching support
Maturity - Optimized: Full knowledge lineage, embedding version control, reproducible RAG, automated drift detection
Success Metrics: Version retrieval time (ms); Storage overhead for versions (%); Rollback success rate (%); Audit trail completeness (%)

Definition: The capability to enable natural language search over enterprise knowledge using semantic understanding rather than keyword matching
Key Components: Query Understanding; Semantic Matching; Contextual Ranking; Query Expansion; Faceted Search; Personalization;  Late Interaction Models; Hybrid Retrieval; Learned Sparse Representations; Query Routing
Technologies: Dense retrieval models (DPR, ColBERT); Vector similarity search; Elasticsearch with k-NN plugin; Reranking models (Cross-Encoder);  ColBERT v2; Hybrid search APIs; Cohere Rerank 3; Jina Reranker; BM25 + dense hybrid
Maturity - Optimized: Hybrid (dense+sparse+rerank), ColBERT late interaction, personalized ranking, 98%+ relevance
Success Metrics: Search relevance (NDCG@10); Query response time (ms); User click-through rate (%); Zero-result queries (%)

Definition: The capability to ground large language model responses in enterprise knowledge by retrieving relevant context before generation
Key Components: Retrieval Pipeline; Context Assembly; Prompt Engineering; Generation Control; Source Attribution; Hybrid RAG;  Agentic RAG; GraphRAG; Self-RAG; Multi-Agent Orchestration; Retrieval Routing; Guardrails
Technologies: LangChain, LlamaIndex; Vector databases; AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases; Custom RAG pipelines;  Agentic RAG frameworks; GraphRAG; Self-RAG; Multi-agent orchestration; Crew AI, AutoGen; MCP integration
Maturity - Basic: Simple retrieval + LLM, no source attribution
Maturity - Optimized: Agentic RAG with multi-hop reasoning, self-correction, GraphRAG for complex queries, 98%+ grounded accuracy
Success Metrics: Answer accuracy (%); Source attribution accuracy (%); Hallucination rate (%); User satisfaction (rating)

Definition: The capability to expose knowledge through well-designed APIs and interfaces for programmatic access by agents and applications
Key Components: RESTful APIs; GraphQL APIs; Streaming APIs; SDKs; API Gateway; API Documentation;  MCP Server Implementation; Standardized Tool Integration; Agent-to-Agent Communication
Technologies: FastAPI, Flask; GraphQL (Apollo, Hasura); AWS API Gateway, Kong; OpenAPI specifications; WebSocket;  Model Context Protocol (MCP); MCP SDKs (Python, TypeScript, C#, Go); A2A Protocol
Maturity - Intermediate: Multiple endpoints, rate limiting, API docs
Maturity - Optimized: MCP-native APIs, universal AI tool integration, agent-to-agent protocols, <50ms latency
Success Metrics: API response time (ms); API uptime (%); Number of API consumers; API error rate (%)

Definition: The capability to intelligently select, combine, and rank knowledge fragments to provide optimal context for specific use cases
Key Components: Relevance Scoring; Reranking; Diversity Control; Context Window Management; Deduplication; Citation Management;  Late Interaction Reranking; Context Compression; Adaptive Window Management; Citation Tracking
Technologies: Cross-encoder reranking models; Maximum Marginal Relevance (MMR) algorithms; Custom ranking models; Context compression techniques;  ColBERT reranking; Cohere Rerank 3; BGE Reranker; Context compression (LLMLingua)
Maturity - Optimized: Multi-stage reranking, context compression, citation-aware assembly, adaptive chunking
Success Metrics: Ranking accuracy (NDCG); Context quality score (%); Deduplication effectiveness (%); Processing latency (ms)

Definition: The capability to provide access to knowledge across different modalities (text, images, audio, video) with unified search and retrieval
Key Components: Multi-Modal Embeddings; Cross-Modal Search; Visual Search; Audio/Video Processing; Document Understanding; Unified Indexing;  Unified Multi-modal RAG; Video Understanding; Document-Image Unified Search
Technologies: CLIP for vision-language models; Whisper for audio transcription; Multi-modal embedding models; AWS Bedrock multi-modal models;  GPT-4V, Claude 3.5 Vision, Gemini Pro Vision; CLIP-2; Unified multi-modal embeddings; Video RAG
Maturity - Optimized: Unified multi-modal RAG, video understanding, document-image-audio unified search, real-time processing
Success Metrics: Cross-modal search accuracy (%); Supported modalities (#); Multi-modal query latency (ms); User adoption of non-text search (%)

Definition: The capability to systematically review, validate, and improve knowledge quality through human and automated processes
Key Components: Content Review Workflows; Expert Validation; Crowdsourced Curation; Automated Quality Checks; Knowledge Deprecation; Continuous Improvement;  LLM Quality Assessment; Automated Fact Verification; Continuous Knowledge Improvement
Technologies: Workflow management systems; Collaborative editing platforms; Quality scoring algorithms; Feedback collection systems;  LLM-assisted curation; Automated quality scoring; Human-in-the-loop platforms; Label Studio
Maturity - Advanced: Automated quality checks, continuous curation, expert networks
Maturity - Optimized: LLM-assisted curation, automated fact-checking, continuous quality improvement, human-in-the-loop validation
Success Metrics: Knowledge freshness (days since update); Curation completion rate (%); User-reported quality issues (#); Expert review coverage (%)

Definition: The capability to measure, monitor, and improve the quality of knowledge across dimensions including accuracy, completeness, consistency, and timeliness
Key Components: Quality Metrics; Data Profiling; Anomaly Detection; Duplicate Detection; Completeness Checks; Quality Scoring;  AI Data Quality Metrics; Embedding Drift Detection; RAG Quality Monitoring; Groundedness Scoring
Technologies: Great Expectations; Apache Griffin; Custom quality rules engines; ML-based anomaly detection;  Soda Core; Monte Carlo; AI-specific data quality (embedding drift, retrieval quality)
Maturity - Optimized: AI-native quality monitoring, embedding drift detection, RAG groundedness scoring, automated remediation
Success Metrics: Data quality score (%); Quality issue detection rate (%); Time to resolve quality issues (hours); Quality trend (improving/stable/declining)

Definition: The capability to secure knowledge through authentication, authorization, encryption, and audit controls
Key Components: Authentication; Authorization; Encryption; Row-Level Security; Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC); Security Monitoring;  AI-Specific Access Control; Prompt Injection Protection; Output Guardrails; AI Audit Trails
Technologies: OAuth 2.0, SAML; Azure Entra ID, Okta; Policy engines (Open Policy Agent); Encryption: TLS 1.3, AES-256;  Zero-trust for AI; Prompt injection protection; Guardrails AI; NeMo Guardrails; AI-specific RBAC
Maturity - Optimized: Zero-trust AI architecture, prompt injection protection, output guardrails, AI-aware access control
Success Metrics: Security incidents (#); Access policy coverage (%); Authentication success rate (%); Audit trail completeness (%)

Definition: The capability to ensure knowledge management practices meet regulatory requirements and provide  audit trails
Key Components: Regulatory Mapping; Audit Logging; Compliance Reporting; Data Retention; Right to Erasure; Compliance Monitoring;  EU AI Act Compliance; ISO/IEC 42001 (AI Management); NIST AI RMF; AI Model Cards; AI Audit Trails
Technologies: Compliance management platforms; Audit log aggregation (Splunk, ELK); Data lineage tracking; Retention policy engines;  EU AI Act compliance tools; ISO/IEC 42001 frameworks; NIST AI RMF; AI audit platforms
Maturity - Intermediate: Automated compliance checks, structured audit logs
Maturity - Optimized: EU AI Act compliant, ISO 42001 certified, automated AI auditing, full model lineage, real-time compliance
Success Metrics: Compliance audit pass rate (%); Audit trail completeness (%); Time to respond to compliance requests (hours); Regulatory violations (#)

Definition: The capability to manage knowledge from creation through retirement, including versioning, archival, and disposal
Key Components: Lifecycle Policies; Content Aging; Archival Strategies; Disposal Processes; Lifecycle Automation; Lifecycle Analytics;  AI Model Lifecycle; Embedding Lifecycle; RAG Pipeline Versioning; Knowledge Deprecation
Technologies: Lifecycle management platforms; Cold storage solutions (AWS Glacier, Azure Archive); Automated workflow systems; Data classification tools;  MLflow; Weights & Biases; AI model lifecycle tools; Knowledge deprecation automation
Maturity - Optimized: Unified knowledge+model lifecycle, automated deprecation, embedding versioning, RAG pipeline CI/CD
Success Metrics: Knowledge freshness score (%); Storage cost optimization ($/GB); Archival compliance rate (%); Lifecycle policy coverage (%)
